Dendronephthya gigantea is known for its ability to release chemical compounds as a defense mechanism against predators and competitors. These compounds can be toxic or irritating to other marine organisms, making the coral less palatable and helping it thrive in its natural habitat.

The ecological importance of Dendronephthya gigantea lies in its contribution to the overall diversity and structure of coral reef ecosystems, providing habitat and shelter for a variety of associated marine species.
